Pre-Game Insights: The New Orleans Pelicans (6-29) visit the Washington Wizards (6-26) after losing 15 road games in a row.
The Pelicans are favored by 4.5 points in the contest, which starts at 6:00 PM ET on Sunday, January 5, 2025.
New Orleans’ record against the spread is 13-22-0.
Washington’s record against the spread is 13-19-0.
As a 4.5-point favorite or greater, the Pelicans have two wins ATS (2-2).
The Wizards’ ATS record as 4.5-point underdogs or greater is 12-19.
The Pelicans and their opponents have scored more than 235.5 points in 11 of 35 games this season.
The Wizards have combined with their opponents to score more than 235.5 points in 13 of 32 games this season.
New Orleans has had an average of 223.4 points in its games this season, 12.1 fewer than this matchup’s total.
Washington has had an average of 231.7 points scored in its games so far this season, 3.8 points fewer than this game’s over/under.
The Pelicans score the 19th-most points in the NBA this season, while the Wizards’ offense racks up the 29th-most.
The Wizards have surrendered the 16th-fewest points in NBA play this season, while the Pelicans have given up the 26th-fewest.
This season, the Pelicans have won three out of the eight games in which they’ve been favored.
The Wizards have been chosen as underdogs in 32 games this year and have walked away with the win six times (18.8%) in those games.
This season, New Orleans has won three of its four games when favored by at least -185 on the moneyline.
This year, Washington has won five of 31 games when listed as at least +150 or better on the moneyline.
Bookmakers have implied with the moneyline set for this matchup that the Pelicans have a 64.9% chance to win.
